meanings.definition: To put a new tread on a tire.
meanings.sent1: I need to retread my worn-out tire before it becomes unsafe to drive on.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will retread the tire to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I should retread my shoes with tire treads for better grip!
meanings.sent4: She decided to retread her life, starting fresh with new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The idea to retread the tire with a different pattern was innovative.

meanings.definition: To rework or reuse something, especially ideas or material.
meanings.sent1: I will retread my essay to improve its quality before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: Artists often retread old concepts in new and creative ways.
meanings.sent3: He tried to retread his failed experiment, hoping for a different outcome.
meanings.sent4: She decided to retread her speech, adding more impactful examples.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to retread the project plan for better efficiency.

meanings.definition: A tire that has been given a new tread.
meanings.sent1: The retread on my tire made it look almost brand new.
meanings.sent2: He opted for a retread instead of buying a completely new tire.
meanings.sent3: The old retread on the tire was starting to show signs of wear.
meanings.sent4: The retread provided better traction on wet roads.
meanings.sent5: The retread was a cost-effective solution for the worn-out tire.
